conclusion: Determine the time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane from the moment object A hits the ground.
Use the kinematic equations of motion to solve the problem.
The tension in the string is equal to the weight of object B, which is 10 N.
Consider the forces acting on object B: gravity downward and friction upward.
The net force acting on object B is mg because friction is negligible.
The acceleration of object B is g.
The velocity of object B at any time t is g * t.
The distance traveled by object B is g * t^2.
The time required for object B to return to the bottom is g * t^2 / 2.
Substituting the given values, the time is 5 seconds.
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is 5 seconds.
